title: Not all passwords importing
content:
Hello all,

I've recently switched back from Chrome to Firefox, imported all passwords, bookmarks etc and off I go...

Only, I'm coming across more and more websites (about four so far) that don't have their logins transferred. The most recent and big one being Twitter, where there are two accounts saved on Chrome, but Firefox says it has none. I've tried all the usual, restarting both browsers and PC, checking there's no security I can find that locks those down (if there is I cannot find it) and the like. I'm on Windows 10 Pro, fully updated with latest patches on all browsers and Win10 itself.

Is this a security thing from those specific sites? Could it be a drastic change to the address fooling Firefox (and if so, why if I go back to Chrome do they load in fine?) or something I'm just not thinking of? I'm really hoping I don't have to keep going back to Chrome randomly to find a password when Firefox finds one it doesn't remember, kind of destroys the purpose of moving away from Google...

Thanks in advance!
creator: lee.bryn.thompson

title: Cant Past text into FireFox adresss bar or websites.
content:
I recently started encountering issues with Firefox where i cant past text.

As an example, i can copy the text in this text field here, and past it into notepad, or Edge. But i cant past it into the address bar on Firefox, or here in this textbox (Cant Past any text into Firefox).

The text is being copied, as i can past it into other applications with no issues. Refreshing Firefox has not fixed or affected the issue.

Running Firefox on troubleshoot mode has not had any effect.

The issue appears to start occurring after Windows 11 goes to sleep, and is then woken up, to resume. Restarting the computer fixes the issue. (Note that terminating the Firefox process and starting it again does not fix the issue).
creator: stianaamodt2

title: crashing / shutting down after current update 116.0.3
content: hello. i did the latest update to version 116.0.3 on both a laptop & a desktop and now firefox randomly crashes and pops up with an error then shuts down and pops up with a message like "Sorry Firefox has en counted an error and is generating a report, do you wish to include pages that you were on and other tech details (something along those words)" i have agreed to this and sent it on a few times from both the Laaptop & desktop so you may have numerous reports from my name or my ip address. i have backed up all my bookmarks and exported them as a html file. so i also tried doing the refresh thing but it still crashes so is there a way i can get rid of every bit of firefox and reinstall say back to the previous version or the one before that. Thank you Garry
creator: garrytune

title: Is Mozilla VPN necessary for using multi-account-containers?
content: Is Mozilla VPN necessary for using multi-account-containers? When i configure multi-account-containers by add proxy info,it warns me with a wrong proxy info.
creator: wanyong_37

title: New York Times Articles Won't Load
content: New York times articles briefly load and then disappear on one iMac. I think it is associated with the fact that the New York Times ads are missing or haven't loaded on that iMac. On our other iMac, New York Times articles load fine and the ads are present. I've looked in the Firefox settings on both and can't find any significant differences differences that would create this problem.
creator: ed121

title: No sound on certain websites.
content: On some sites like youtube, crunchryroll, and other sites usually where it's main purpose is to play videos my sound plays fine. However, on other sites like osu's website, chess.com, duolingo, and others, there's no sound at all. I've tried refreshing, restarting, running in safe mode, and even reinstalling the browser but none of it has worked. My tabs are also not muted. Does anyone know how to fix this?
creator: maxmoulton150

title: How to display last 4 digits of credit card number next to expiry date
content:
Hello,

Sometimes Firefox's AutoFill doesn't fill all relevant boxes at once, and requires each box to be manually clicked one after another (i.e. click the 1st to fill in the credit card number, then click the 2st box to fill in the expiry date, and so on). If you have a few card numbers stored, this gets really annoying because there's no way to tell which expiry date corresponds to the credit card number that you filled in previously. Is there a way for Firefox to display the last 4 digits of the card number next to the expiry dates?

I've attached a screenshot to illustrate the issue.

Many thanks!
creator: richardyusen

title: Master Volume changes on windows 10
content: Hello, i've been using firefox for a very long time and just over the last year i've ran into an issue where when the firefox window is selected my entire system's audio ducks to 80 percent then returns to whatever volume i had it set to when i select a different window that isnt firefox. I have checked the communications tab under sound settings to verify that my system is to do nothing when i switch between applications, so i am assuming this is not the cause. are you aware of any issues like this happening? i cannot find answers on your website or forums
creator: evanicox3
